wikipedia_page.main: Michael Leonard (born 20 February 1974 in Knutsford) is a male field hockey defender from Scotland, who earned his first cap for the Men's National Team in 1996. He plays club hockey for Grange. Leonard has also been capped six times for the Scotland B cricket team.

response: Michael Leonard is the name of:
* Michael Leonard (field hockey) (born 1974), Scottish field hockey player

link_mentions.page: Hockey at the 2006 Commonwealth Games – Men's team squads
response: (1.) Alistair McGregor, (2.) David Mitchell, (3.) Michael Leonard, (4.) Adam MacKenzie, (5.) Niall Stott, (6.) Jonathan Christie, (7.) David Mansouri, (8.) Vishal Marwaha, (9.) Graham Moodie, (10.) Douglas Simpson, (11.) Mark Ralph, (12.) Michael Christie, (13.) Allan Dick, (14.) David Ralph, (15.) Stephen Dick, and (16.) Graham Dunlop. Head Coach: Mathias Ahrens.
